Release Notes:

Kleerup was half of the act responsible for the number 1 hit
single, 'With Every Heartbeat'. The other half was of course
the feisty asymetrically fringed Robyn .  His melancholic
electro-pop framed Robyn's ballad about break-up perfectly and
secured it as one of the most prolific pop moments of 2007.
As they wrote the song together they agreed call it 'Robyn
with Kleerup' on her album and 'Kleerup with Robyn' on his
album.

He is already a massive star in is native home having won no
less than three awards (Best Newcomer, Best Composer and Best
Producer) at Sweden's 2009 Grammis music awards recently (the
equivalent of our Brits).

Ok, so he's huge back home, is mates with Robyn and has had a
number one single in the UK. So what you may ask.  Well this
bearded lothario with grungy locks is about to embark on
another assault of our shores with his own self-titled album.

'Kleerup' features collaborations with Lykke Li,  Marit
Bergman, Titiyo  (Neneh Cherry's younger sister) and the of
course includes his hit collaboration with Robyn.   Kleerup's
songs are a mixture of his familiar formula of electronica and
Swedish female vocal. Good thing this is a formula with proven
results as each one is pure electro-pop perfection.

The lead single with Titiyo, 'Longing For Lullabies'
encapsulates his warm and melancholic sound flawlessly. On the
flip side emotive 'Until We Bleed', Kleerup draws a
surprisingly warm performance from the blog friendly Lykke Li.
Plus there's a host of remixes that beef it up for the
dancefloor from.

Available from May 17th, album release to follow on June 1st
2009
